s.text: While the public waits, lobbyists purchase uncorrected transcripts from pricey transcription agencies.
Still, citizens often have to wait weeks for research that a congressional staffer can download in seconds.
Ruskin argues that posting the reports would allow citizens to trace patterns of influence.
These reports detail how much lobbyists are paid to work on a particular issue and in theory what, who, and how they lobby.
To find out about congressional hearings, the curious must locate the appropriate committee site.
